item.title: Automate Cisco ssh connections with plink in Windows
item.description: A quick and dirty way to send a bunch of commands to any ssh device (in my case, Cisco appliances)… create a plain old batch file with commands echoed inside: @echo off echo ter len 0 echo show ver echo show clock echo exit execute the batch, piping its output to plink.exe (putty command link ssh client): c:\> commands.bat | plink -ssh -l username -pw password 11.22.33.44
